title.narrative: 006 CHD FOR VAS, DW & NUT. SCREENING

description.narrative: 102/006 Conduct CHD for biannual VAS and deworming and for quarterly nutritional screening for SAM and MAM, which contributes to Micronutrients, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 1.2 At least 80% of Children, youth and women in rural, pastoralist and urban areas use quality, gender sensitive and equitable preventive, promotive and basic curative health and nutrition services at community and health post level by 2015.

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House (Kazanchis - Opposite UNECA/German House) P.O. Box 1169 Addis Ababa

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Vitamin A supplementation in early childhood (children under 5)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 102/006 Conduct CHD for biannual VAS and deworming and for quarterly nutritional screening for SAM and MAM
1: Number of children 6-59 months supplemented with vitamin A every six months
2: Number of woredas screening children for malnutrition quarterly
